subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to unit test Eclipse Plugin and RCP?
msgSnippet: ... That s why I also have acceptance tests that run from the Eclipse GUI--this covers both my testing needs (the classes do what I think, and the application
messageBody:
uab_bound2003 wrote:
> I have a similar machine 2.4Ghz pentium m , 1 gb ram . I experience
> similar startup times . And to me the wait is worth it ,since i am
> not mocking out platform stuff and be sure that it "really" worked .
> I never have that kind of confidence when i mock out stuff.

That's why I also have acceptance tests that run from the Eclipse
GUI--this covers both my testing needs (the classes do what I think, and
the application does what the user wants). However, you'd be surprised
how seldom I'm surprised by acceptance test failures that aren't caught
by the developer tests. (10 times as fast)

David Saff
